class_notes: Also offered as IBS 547/548.)  Location:  Calhoun Auditorium (Emory Clinic).  This course is for juniors, seniors, and graduate students who may be interested in a basic understanding of the eye. This course will review basic principles and state-of-the-art information on ocular anatomy, embryology, biochemistry, physiology, genetics, immunology, microbiology, pharmacology, and pathology. Prerequisites: Biology 142 and Biology 142L. This course ORIGINATES in the Department of OPHTHALMOLOGY (taught by D. Pardue) and may be taken as elective credit for the biology major.
